noun.description: A method of transmitting or receiving data (especially video and audio material) over a computer network as a steady, continuous flow, allowing playback to start while the rest of the data is still being received.
The practice of putting schoolchildren in groups of the same age and ability to be taught together.
examples: streaming within secondary schools is common practice

adjective.description: Relating to or making use of a form of tape transport, used mainly to provide backup storage, in which data may be transferred in bulk while the tape is in motion.
Of or relating to data transmitted in a continuous stream while earlier parts are being used.
(of a cold) accompanied by copious running of the nose and eyes.
